dismissalText.commentary: Chamara Silva lbw b Abdur Razzak 65 (76b 8x4 1x6 102m) SR: 85.52

dismissalComment.html: that's close and Asoka de Silva raises the finger! Razzak bowls a quicker ball on middle stump and it goes straight through to Silva who moves back and tries to flick, he misses and the ball hits him on the back pad plumb in front, big wicket for Bangladesh during the final overs

dismissalComment.html: caught! Mortaza bangs it in short on off stump, Dilshan tries to pull and loses grip of his bat, the ball flies off the edge towards Ashraful at cover, who takes an easy catch, while the bat flies a fair distance towards Rasel at midwicket

dismissalComment.html: bowled him, Rasel pitches one outside off stump and cuts it back into Jayasuriya who pushes away from his body with a gap between bat and pad, the ball bats the inside edge of Jayasuriya's bat and crashes into off stump, that moves a fair bit off the pitch into the left-hander, huge wicket for Bangladesh

dismissalComment.html: caught! Rasel slants one across Jayawardene who moves on to the front foot and spoons the cover drive to Shakib at cover, that was a simple catch, lazy shot from Jayawardene, the length wasn't there for the drive and he played away from his body, a soft dismissal

dismissalText.commentary: Abdur Razzak run out (Dilshan/†Sangakkara) 28 (27b 1x4 3x6 27m) SR: 103.7

dismissalComment.html: that's the end of the match, Rasel moves on to the back foot and nudges towards midwicket for a quick single, Dilshan charges in from midwicket, the pick up is spot on and he fires the throw into Sangakkara who whips off the bails in a flash with Razzak inches short of his crease

Fernando has two in the same over! He bowls full and straight, Imran takes half a stride across his stumps and is caught on the crease when the ball thuds into pad, Asoka de Silva takes his time but eventually raises the finger

commentTextItems.html: that's the end of the match, Rasel moves on to the back foot and nudges towards midwicket for a quick single, Dilshan charges in from midwicket, the pick up is spot on and he fires the throw into Sangakkara who whips off the bails in a flash with Razzak inches short of his crease

commentPostTextItems.html: 5.13 pm Sri Lanka have won the first match of the three-ODI series by 70 runs. Bangladesh had an excellent opportunity to win this game after their bowlers kept Sri Lanka to 235 and Nafees and Tamim added 45 for the first wicket.

Then Fernando tirggered the slide and Bangladesh lost five wickets for eleven runs, a position from which they never recovered. Fernando finished with 4 for 24 off nine overs and wins the Man-of-the-Match award for his effort.

The next one-dayer is on Monday. Do join us for that game which begins at 10.00 am. In the meantime, our coverage of the Lord's Test between England and India is currently underway. It's been raining heavily in London, tune in to Jamie Alter to find out what the chances of play are. Cheers.

commentTextItems.html: flicked off the pads through midwicket

commentPreTextItems.html: We're into the final ten overs now. Bangladesh need another 72 runs with one wicket in hand. Jehan Mubarak replaces Fernando. He's going to bowl offspin from over the wicket.

commentTextItems.html: flat ball on leg and middle, defended on the front foot
blocked on the front foot

commentTextItems.html: another short ball but wider outside the off stump this time
another one takes off from a good length and surprises Razzak who has to drop his wrists to avoid playing the ball
bowled short of a length on off stump, the ball gets big on Razzak who moves back in his crease and takes one hand off the bat while defending
defended on the back foot towards Fernando
Fernando angles the ball into Razzak from round the wicket, Razzak is cramped for room and defends on the back foot
Fernando bowls one down leg side, easy decision for the umpire to make
pushed off the back foot towards fine leg

dismissalComment.html: caught at slip, Fernando pitches the ball short of  a length on middle stump and angles it across Tamim who hardly moves his feet and plays with the bat away from the body, he gets a thick edge through to Jayawardene at waist height

Fernando has two in the same over! He bowls full and straight, Imran takes half a stride across his stumps and is caught on the crease when the ball thuds into pad, Asoka de Silva takes his time but eventually raises the finger

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Ashraful player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Ashraful player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Ashraful falls, Fernando gives him another short delivery, Ashraful tries to play a pull but mis-times it and gets a top edge that flies somewhere mid-way towards fine leg, Sangakkara and Jayawardene, at first slip, both give chase but Maharoof runs in from the fine-leg fence, slides as he reaches the ball, and takes a well-judged catch

headshotImage.caption: Shahriar Nafees player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shahriar Nafees player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: it's Nafees' turn to go, the carnage continues, Fernando bowls the heavy ball short of  a length and angles it into Nafees, Nafees moves back in his crease and closes the face of the bat to play the ball through midwicket, the ball hits the inside edge and bounced off the thigh pad to Silva at gully

dismissalText.commentary: Abdur Razzak run out (Dilshan/†Sangakkara) 28 (27b 1x4 3x6 27m) SR: 103.7

dismissalComment.html: that's the end of the match, Rasel moves on to the back foot and nudges towards midwicket for a quick single, Dilshan charges in from midwicket, the pick up is spot on and he fires the throw into Sangakkara who whips off the bails in a flash with Razzak inches short of his crease

stories.seoTitle: Jayawardene is all praise for Fernando
stories.summary: Sri Lanka captain Mahela Jayawardene heaped praise on his bowlers, especially Dilhara Fernando, after his team had completed a comprehensive 70-runs victory over Bangladesh in the first ODI

stories.title: Saravanamuttu Stadium undergoes major revamp
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka's first cricket stadium with Wi-Fi facilities
stories.summary: The P. Saravanamuttu Stadium has been the first stadium to be upgraded just days after the local and foreign media lambasted its facilities during the second Test against Bangladesh.

stories.seoTitle: Formidable Fernando powers Sri Lanka to easy win
stories.summary: Dilhara Fernando sashayed his way through a brittle top order, and with Farvez Maharoof playing sidekick ensured Sri Lanka sealed a facile win in the first ODI against Bangladesh at Colombo
